choices.B: Download .pl files and look for usernames and passwords
choices.A: Edit the discovered file with one line of code for remote callback
choices.C: Edit the smb.conf file and upload it to the server
choices.D: Download the smb.conf file and look at configurations

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Option A (edit the discovered file with one line of code for remote callback) may allow the tester to execute arbitrary code on the server if successful. However, this option may not provide long-term access to the machine and may be detected and blocked by security controls.

Option C (edit the smb.conf file and upload it to the server) may allow the tester to modify the configuration of the machine to gain access. This option may be more effective in gaining long-term access and may be less likely to be detected by security controls.

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A because the SMB.conf file won't give you internal access to the system, it would only be effective for Remote File Inclusion (RFI) which has already been achieved.

Selected Answer: A
My guess is A on this

Selected Answer: C
Before you can forward the packet you need to create it, you can create packets using Scapy. 
Answer "A" assumes that the packet is already crafted which is wrong. 
https://thepacketgeek.com/scapy/building-network-tools/part-09/

Selected Answer: C
In The Official CompTIA PenTest+ Student Guide (Exam PT0-002) the term of "socat" it doesn't even exist :(

questions.question_text: A penetration tester has established an on-path attack position and must now specially craft a DNS query response to be sent back to a target host. Which of the following utilities would BEST support this objective?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
https://www.redhat.com/sysadmin/simple-http-server
"Another option is to use wget or curl to download the files to the remote system.

wget http://<ip>:8000/filename
curl http://<ip>:8000/filename
"

questions.question_text:
A penetration tester ran the following command on a staging server: python `"m SimpleHTTPServer 9891
Which of the following commands could be used to download a file named exploit to a target machine for execution?

When developing a shell script intended for interpretation in Bash, the interpreter /bin/bash should be explicitly specified. Which of the following character combinations should be used on the first line of the script to accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
Yes it is E, called a “she-bang”
This must be E. (#!/bin/bash) this is how it start

questions.question_text: In an unprotected network file repository, a penetration tester discovers a text file containing usernames and passwords in cleartext and a spreadsheet containing data for 50 employees, including full names, roles, and serial numbers. The tester realizes some of the passwords in the text file follow the format: <name- serial_number>. Which of the following would be the best action for the tester to take NEXT with this information?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
unprotected network file repository, a penetration tester discovers ... i think A hes a penetration tester so he should proceed to penetrate?

comments.content: same question on pt0-002 and D is not listed as an answer......

discussion.content: why not A - don't you have to validate first if the findings are relevant or nah ?

comments.content: who makes a spreadsheet for 50 employees who don't exist? the given answer is correct -_-
That is a good point, well said

choices.A: Create a custom password dictionary as preparation for password spray testing.
choices.D: Document the unprotected file repository as a finding in the penetration-testing report.
choices.B: Recommend using a password manage/vault instead of text files to store passwords securely.
choices.C: Recommend configuring password complexity rules in all the systems and applications.
